results.title: Wool Fashion Award
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Against a background of beauty spots in Sydney, models display the winning styles in frocks, sportswear and costumes of the first fashion awards presented in Australia in 1956. Credits include: fashion adviser Pat Woodley; accessories by David Jones Ltd; photographed by George Heath; compered by Bob Pollard and edited by Sydney Whiteley.

results.title: Trout in the Karri Country
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the pleasures of trout fishing in the forest streams of south-west Western Australia. Also shows the whole process of breeding from the stripping of ova from the female, the milking of the male, the growth of the ova, the hatching and growth of the fingerlings and the final release of the young fish into farm dams and streams.

results.title: The Trout harvest
results.creator_credit: Ted Davis, Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Victoria. Dept. of Fisheries and Wildlife
results.brief_description: The Snobs Creek fish hatchery was newly established at this time, and this film shows how the fish are bred from the egg stage to liberation into rivers and lakes. This film was included in the San Francisco Film Festival 1961.

results.title: Trees to tame the wind
results.brief_description: In this film we are introduced to a farmer and his son who, in 1934, were distressed by the damage wrought by drought and wind to their farm. At the suggestion of the Forest Service Officer, the farmer decided to carry out a Forest Service plan for planting trees to act as wind-breaks and shelter-belts on his farm, as part of the Prairie States Forestry Project “The Shelterbelt” which extended from North Dakota to Texas. By 1939, this kind of tree planting was being encouraged all over the prairie farmlands in the United States with participation by the farmers an essential part of the program.

results.title: Tractor driving
results.brief_description: Very clearly this film gives hints on the maintenance, driving and safety precautions to be taken with a tractor. “A well maintained machine will be a safer machine and give you better value over its work life.”

results.title: Toronto jazz
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Toronto is regarded as the third largest jazz centre in North America. This film features a cross-section of jazz bands of that city: the Lenny Breau Trio, the Don Thompson Quintet and the Alf Jones Quartet. Their styles show creative self-expression, hard work, and improvisation.

results.title: Tor Schwanck: gold and silversmith
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”
Metal-work has been in Tor Schwanck’s family since the 15th century. He is an artisan trained in all aspects of metal-work. Schwanck uses non-precious metals as well as gold and silver. All the designs are originals, and he tours, exhibits and receives commissions for his work.

results.title: Spread your wings: making it with TAFE
results.creator_credit: John O'Shea, Chris Stewart, Documentary Films and Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: An impressionistic film which is intended to provide information about the opportunities offered by Technical and Further Education in vocational training, and in recreational courses to meet community requirements. It is not intended to give detailed information on the breadth of courses and curricula but is rather a stimulus film aimed at encouraging enrolment.
